messages.content: You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Hf2N is Rutile structured and crystallizes in the tetragonal P4_2/mnm space group. Hf(1) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. There is one shorter (2.22 Å) and two longer (2.23 Å) Hf(1)-N(1) bond lengths. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Hf(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NHf6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 47°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.4078241012500001 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Hf3N2 crystallizes in the trigonal R3m space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of three Hf3N2 sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. There are three inequivalent Hf sites. In the first Hf site, Hf(1) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. All Hf(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.26 Å. In the second Hf site, Hf(2) is bonded to three equivalent N(1) and three equivalent N(2) atoms to form distorted edge-sharing HfN6 pentagonal pyramids. All Hf(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.28 Å. All Hf(2)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.32 Å. In the third Hf site, Hf(3) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(2) atoms. All Hf(3)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.24 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to three equivalent Hf(1) and three equivalent Hf(2) atoms to form a mixture of corner, edge, and face-sharing NHf6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 47°. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to three equivalent Hf(2) and three equivalent Hf(3) atoms to form a mixture of corner, edge, and face-sharing NHf6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 47°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.5890352555000051 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Hf3N2 is MAX Phase-derived structured and crystallizes in the trigonal R-3m space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of three Hf3N2 sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. There are two inequivalent Hf sites. In the first Hf site, Hf(1) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. All Hf(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.29 Å. In the second Hf site, Hf(2) is bonded to six equivalent N(1) atoms to form edge-sharing HfN6 octahedra. All Hf(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.24 Å. N(1) is bonded to three equivalent Hf(1) and three equivalent Hf(2) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NHf6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.683426963500005 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Hf3N4 crystallizes in the cubic I-43d space group. Hf(1) is bonded in a 8-coordinate geometry to eight equivalent N(1) atoms. There are four shorter (2.21 Å) and four longer (2.45 Å) Hf(1)-N(1) bond lengths. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Hf(1) atoms to form a mixture of distorted corner, edge, and face-sharing NHf6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 20-48°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 1.0259 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.9047627092857131 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Hf3N4 crystallizes in the trigonal R-3m space group. There are two inequivalent Hf sites. In the first Hf site, Hf(1) is bonded in a 7-coordinate geometry to three equivalent N(1) and four equivalent N(2) atoms. All Hf(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.59 Å. There are three shorter (2.04 Å) and one longer (2.26 Å) Hf(1)-N(2) bond length. In the second Hf site, Hf(2) is bonded to six equivalent N(1) atoms to form edge-sharing HfN6 octahedra. All Hf(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.27 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to three equivalent Hf(1) and three equivalent Hf(2) atoms to form NHf6 octahedra that share corners with three equivalent N(1)Hf6 octahedra, corners with six equivalent N(2)Hf4 tetrahedra, edges with nine equivalent N(1)Hf6 octahedra, and edges with three equivalent N(2)Hf4 tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to four equivalent Hf(1) atoms to form NHf4 tetrahedra that share corners with six equivalent N(1)Hf6 octahedra, corners with six equivalent N(2)Hf4 tetrahedra, edges with three equivalent N(1)Hf6 octahedra, and edges with three equivalent N(2)Hf4 tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 25-50°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 1.0917 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.900440968571428 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Hf3N4 is Hausmannite structured and crystallizes in the cubic Fd-3m space group. There are two inequivalent Hf sites. In the first Hf site, Hf(1) is bonded to six equivalent N(1) atoms to form HfN6 octahedra that share corners with six equivalent Hf(2)N4 tetrahedra and edges with six equivalent Hf(1)N6 octahedra. All Hf(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.19 Å. In the second Hf site, Hf(2) is bonded to four equivalent N(1) atoms to form corner-sharing HfN4 tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 57°. All Hf(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.07 Å. N(1) is bonded in a distorted rectangular see-saw-like geometry to one Hf(2) and three equivalent Hf(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.9216000000000001 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.955255585000003 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Hf3N4 crystallizes in the orthorhombic Pnma space group. There are three inequivalent Hf sites. In the first Hf site, Hf(1) is bonded to one N(4), two equivalent N(1), and three equivalent N(3) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing HfN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 5-69°. The Hf(1)-N(4) bond length is 2.11 Å. Both Hf(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.08 Å. There are two shorter (2.32 Å) and one longer (2.35 Å) Hf(1)-N(3) bond length. In the second Hf site, Hf(2) is bonded in a 7-coordinate geometry to one N(1), one N(3), two equivalent N(4), and three equivalent N(2) atoms. The Hf(2)-N(1) bond length is 2.16 Å. The Hf(2)-N(3) bond length is 2.74 Å. Both Hf(2)-N(4) bond lengths are 2.44 Å. There are two shorter (2.08 Å) and one longer (2.15 Å) Hf(2)-N(2) bond length. In the third Hf site, Hf(3) is bonded to one N(1), one N(2), two equivalent N(3), and two equivalent N(4) atoms to form a mixture of distorted corner and edge-sharing HfN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 5-69°. The Hf(3)-N(1) bond length is 2.29 Å. The Hf(3)-N(2) bond length is 2.07 Å. Both Hf(3)-N(3) bond lengths are 2.28 Å. Both Hf(3)-N(4) bond lengths are 2.19 Å. There are four inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to one Hf(2), one Hf(3), and two equivalent Hf(1) atoms to form distorted NHf4 trigonal pyramids that share corners with three equivalent N(3)Hf6 octahedra, corners with four equivalent N(2)Hf4 tetrahedra, corners with two equivalent N(1)Hf4 trigonal pyramids, and edges with three equivalent N(3)Hf6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 10-38°. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to one Hf(3) and three equivalent Hf(2) atoms to form NHf4 tetrahedra that share  a cornercorner with one N(3)Hf6 octahedra, corners with two equivalent N(2)Hf4 tetrahedra, corners with four equivalent N(1)Hf4 trigonal pyramids, edges with two equivalent N(3)Hf6 octahedra, and edges with two equivalent N(2)Hf4 tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 44°. In the third N site, N(3) is bonded to one Hf(2), two equivalent Hf(3), and three equivalent Hf(1) atoms to form distorted NHf6 octahedra that share  a cornercorner with one N(2)Hf4 tetrahedra, corners with three equivalent N(1)Hf4 trigonal pyramids, edges with four equivalent N(3)Hf6 octahedra, edges with two equivalent N(2)Hf4 tetrahedra, and edges with three equivalent N(1)Hf4 trigonal pyramids. In the fourth N site, N(4) is bonded in a 5-coordinate geometry to one Hf(1), two equivalent Hf(2), and two equivalent Hf(3) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 1.2648000000000001 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.9739463853571442 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Hf4N3 is MAX Phase-derived structured and crystallizes in the trigonal R3m space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of three Hf4N3 sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. There are four inequivalent Hf sites. In the first Hf site, Hf(1) is bonded to three equivalent N(2) and three equivalent N(3) atoms to form a mixture of distorted corner and edge-sharing HfN6 pentagonal pyramids. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 2°. All Hf(1)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.28 Å. All Hf(1)-N(3) bond lengths are 2.32 Å. In the second Hf site, Hf(2) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(2) atoms. All Hf(2)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.22 Å. In the third Hf site, Hf(3) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. All Hf(3)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.30 Å. In the fourth Hf site, Hf(4) is bonded to three equivalent N(1) and three equivalent N(3) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing HfN6 octahedra. All Hf(4)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.20 Å. All Hf(4)-N(3) bond lengths are 2.25 Å. There are three inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to three equivalent Hf(3) and three equivalent Hf(4) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NHf6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 2°. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to three equivalent Hf(1) and three equivalent Hf(2) atoms to form a mixture of corner, edge, and face-sharing NHf6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 47°. In the third N site, N(3) is bonded to three equivalent Hf(1) and three equivalent Hf(4) atoms to form a mixture of corner, edge, and face-sharing NHf6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 2-47°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.7253764866071442 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Hf4N3 crystallizes in the tetragonal I4/mmm space group. There are two inequivalent Hf sites. In the first Hf site, Hf(1) is bonded to one N(2) and four equivalent N(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing HfN5 square pyramids. The Hf(1)-N(2) bond length is 2.18 Å. All Hf(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.25 Å. In the second Hf site, Hf(2) is bonded in a square co-planar geometry to two equivalent N(1) and two equivalent N(2) atoms. Both Hf(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.27 Å. Both Hf(2)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.25 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(2) is bonded to two equivalent Hf(1) and four equivalent Hf(2) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NHf6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. In the second N site, N(1) is bonded to two equivalent Hf(2) and four equivalent Hf(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NHf6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 0-5°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.70173151232143 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

All Hf(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.44 Å. N(1) is bonded in a body-centered cubic geometry to eight equivalent Hf(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?

All Hf(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.13 Å. N(1) is bonded to four equivalent Hf(1) atoms to form corner-sharing NHf4 tetrahedra. N(1) is bonded to three equivalent Hf(1) and one N(1) atom to form a mixture of distorted corner and face-sharing NHf3N trigonal pyramids. The N(1)-N(1) bond length is 1.44 Å. HfN2 is Pyrite-like structured and crystallizes in the cubic Pa-3 space group. Hf(1) is bonded to six equivalent N(1) atoms to form HfN6 octahedra that share corners with twelve equivalent Hf(1)N6 octahedra and corners with six equivalent N(1)Hf3N tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 70°. All Hf(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.21 Å. N(1) is bonded to three equivalent Hf(1) and one N(1) atom to form NHf3N tetrahedra that share corners with three equivalent Hf(1)N6 octahedra and corners with fifteen equivalent N(1)Hf3N tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 71°. The N(1)-N(1) bond length is 1.51 Å. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 1.188099999999999 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.12026927083333 eV/atom.
